body: Simplified and condensed a bit: https://psalm.dev/r/d6d08bda2f
I'd like to try to fix this, where shall I start?

I usually start with running Psalm on the failing snippet with `--debug-emitted-issues --threads=1 --no-cache` flags. It produces backtrace pinpointing the place where the error is emitted. Then work back from there.

`PSALM_ALLOW_XDEBUG=1 psalm --no-cache --threads=1` allows step debugging with Xdebug.

It looks like [MethodComparator::create](https://github.com/vimeo/psalm/blob/6097e027730373dcc6473fbf334484ad904e37b9/src/Psalm/Internal/Analyzer/MethodComparator.php#L41) gets called twice for the above example. It first compares the two traits, then it attempts to compare ``Test`` class with ``AnotherTrait`` and the test fails. I've added some diagnostic messages and got:

```
comparing: 'AggregateTrait' with 'AnotherTrait': success                        
comparing: 'Test' with 'AnotherTrait': failure                                  
```

I observed that the comparison is successfull as long as the implementer class(like) is a trait. This may also be infered from the code of  [MethodComparator::compareMethodDocblockReturnType()](https://github.com/vimeo/psalm/blob/6097e027730373dcc6473fbf334484ad904e37b9/src/Psalm/Internal/Analyzer/MethodComparator.php#L657). If it's not a trait, then (``Test`` class in our case), then the [code](https://github.com/vimeo/psalm/blob/6097e027730373dcc6473fbf334484ad904e37b9/src/Psalm/Internal/Analyzer/MethodComparator.php#L696) that transforms template parameters is not executed, and the information about "int" type provided as parameter to ``@template-use AnotherTrait`` is not used.

The question is now, where to dig further to find an solution?

issue.title: Property not set in constructor when using trait in abstract class

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.body:
I think I've found a strange behaviour, in this snippet psalm complains about a property not set in constructor when the concrete class extends an abstract class using a trait.

https://psalm.dev/r/5a9fe1453e

If I take rid of the abstract class everything is fine.

https://psalm.dev/r/13cce84db7

It's a bug?

issue.title: Attempt to fix #6937

labels.name: release:fix
labels.description: The PR will be included in 'Fixes' section of the release notes

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.body: Just a blind shot, prehaps completely wrong. But maybe a good starting point for discussion.

issue.title: ImplementedReturnTypeMismatch on method implemented in non-template trait and declared abstract in a templated trait

repository.name: psalm
repository.description: A PHP static analysis tool for finding errors and security vulnerabilities in PHP applications

issue.body:
https://psalm.dev/r/97a5b80220

It's not a duplicate of #6937. The #6963 does not fix this, but I think I have a fix for it.
